H0.text: Nuclear fission is the name of the process in which the nuclei of uranium atoms are split.

H1.text: Critical fission is the name of the process in which the nuclei of uranium atoms are split.

H2.text: Atomic fusion is the process in which the nuclei of uranium atoms are split.

H3.text: Nuclear fusion is the process in which the nuclei of uranium atoms are split.

A4.text: When a uranium nucleus fissions into two daughter nuclei fragments, about 0.1 percent of the mass of the uranium nucleus appears as the fission energy of ~200 MeV.

A5.text: The fission of 235U by a slow neutron yields nearly identical energy to the fission of 238U by a fast neutron.
